bibl.title: The Last Pharaohs. Egypt under the Ptolemies, 305-30 BC.
bibl.note: Introduction. - 1. Egypt in the First Millennium BC. - 2. The Historical Understanding of the Ptolemaic State. - 3. Moving beyond Despotism, Economic Planning, and State Banditry. Ptolemaic Egypt as a Premodern State. - 4. Shaping a New State. The Political Economy of the Ptolemies. - 5. Creating a New Economic Order. Economic Life and Economic Policy under the Ptolemies. - 6. Order and Law. Shaping the Law in a New State. - 7. Conclusions. - Pp. 207-216: Appendix. The Trial Record of the Property Dispute Held at the Temple of Wepwawet in Asyut, Upper Egypt, 170 BC before the Local Laokritai-judges: pSiut 1 (= pBM inv. 10591, recto). - Bibliography. Index. Index of Sources.
bibl.seg: MANNING Joe G., The Last Pharaohs. Egypt under the Ptolemies, 305-30 BC.
Princeton - Oxford, Princeton University Press, 2010, 8°, xvi-264 pp., front., 16 figg., 1 carte. ISBN 978-0-691-14262-3. $39.50.

Introduction. - 1. Egypt in the First Millennium BC. - 2. The Historical Understanding of the Ptolemaic State. - 3. Moving beyond Despotism, Economic Planning, and State Banditry. Ptolemaic Egypt as a Premodern State. - 4. Shaping a New State. The Political Economy of the Ptolemies. - 5. Creating a New Economic Order. Economic Life and Economic Policy under the Ptolemies. - 6. Order and Law. Shaping the Law in a New State. - 7. Conclusions. - Pp. 207-216: Appendix. The Trial Record of the Property Dispute Held at the Temple of Wepwawet in Asyut, Upper Egypt, 170 BC before the Local Laokritai-judges: pSiut 1 (= pBM inv. 10591, recto). - Bibliography. Index. C.R. par Timothy Howe, BMCRev < http://bmcr.brynmawr.edu/2010/2010-04-41.html >. - Arthur Verhoogt, BASP 48 (2011) pp. 305-306.
